skill.name: enact/hello-go
skill.description: A simple Go greeting tool that prints personalized greetings. Takes a name input and returns a formatted greeting message with Go version information.
skill.author: EnactProtocol

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill is a simple Go greeting tool with no network access, no file writes, and no secret handling. Static scanner incorrectly flagged Go import syntax as dynamic import, YAML frontmatter as cryptographic algorithms, and documentation code blocks as shell execution. No malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Need to generate friendly greeting messages for users or testing? This skill prints personalized greetings with Go version information for development and demonstration purposes.
actual_capabilities: Takes a name parameter and generates a personalized greeting
Outputs greeting in format: Hello, {name}! with emoji
Returns structured JSON output with greeting data
limitations: Only outputs static greeting text, no dynamic content generation
No network or API integration capabilities
Limited to single name input parameter
Cannot persist data or maintain state between calls

use_cases.title: Development Testing
use_cases.description: Test Enact skill workflows and CLI interactions by running a simple Go example that outputs predictable greeting messages.

use_cases.title: Documentation Examples
use_cases.description: Use as a minimal working example in documentation to demonstrate Enact skill structure and input/output patterns.

use_cases.title: Quick Greets
use_cases.description: Generate simple greeting messages for demos, prototypes, or user onboarding flows that need friendly welcome text.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Greeting
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the enact/hello-go skill to greet me with the name Alice.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Name Greeting
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the hello-go skill to greet someone named ${user_name}.

prompt_templates.title: Greets with Version Info
prompt_templates.prompt: Use enact/hello-go to greet ${name} and show what Go version is running.

prompt_templates.title: Batch Greets
prompt_templates.prompt: Use enact/hello-go to generate greetings for a list of names: Bob, Carol, Dave. Show me each greeting output.
prompt_templates.scenario: Multiple consecutive greetings in one session

output_examples.output:
Hello, Claude User! üêπ
Go version: go1.23.0

best_practices: Use for testing and development before building more complex Enact skills
Combine with other skills to create greeting workflows with multiple steps
Check the output JSON structure when integrating into automated pipelines
anti_patterns: Do not use for production user-facing greetings without adding customization logic
Do not expect rich formatting or HTML output - it only prints plain text
Do not assume state persistence between calls

faq.question: What does this skill actually do?
faq.answer: It runs a Go program that takes a name input and prints Hello, {name}! with an emoji and the Go version. It returns the greeting as structured data.

faq.question: Can I customize the greeting message?
faq.answer: No, the greeting format is fixed. You can only change the name parameter. For custom messages, build a new Enact skill.

faq.question: What input does this skill accept?
faq.answer: A single string parameter called 'name'. If no name is provided, it defaults to 'World'.

faq.question: Does this skill make network requests?
faq.answer: No, this skill only executes locally. It does not call any external APIs or services.

faq.question: Can I use this in production applications?
faq.answer: This is an example skill for learning and testing. For production, create a dedicated skill with error handling and validation.

faq.question: What Go version is used?
faq.answer: This skill runs on Go 1.23 in an Alpine Linux container. The exact version is shown in the output.
